info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 28 at 12:12PM MDT until July 28 at 3:15PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Bernalillo County in central New Mexico... Northwestern Torrance County in central New Mexico... Eastern Valencia County in central New Mexico... * Until 315 PM MDT. * At 1212 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.5 and 1.25 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 0.5 to 1.25 inches in 0.5 hours and 30 minutes. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Escabosa, Ponderosa Pines, Miera and Cedro. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.5-1.25 INCHES IN 0.5 HOURS AND 30 MINUTES
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Do not enter or cross flowing water or water of unknown depth.
